title: (x) Geometric bold sans 'Ongoing Series' - Neuzeit (custom by Laurenz Brunner) {Yves (Angel)}
content:
This is some publicity from Museum de Paviljoen in Almere, Holland. In the list of credits it mentions Laurenz Brunner so there’s a chance it’s custom, but I think there might be something close. My searches haven’t turned up much so any help gratefully received...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071106043347im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Untitled-1_5801.jpg)

 [‹ Suggestions for numbers/figures](http://web.archive.org/web/20071106043347/http:/typophile.com/node/38758 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Which weight of Balantines Script is this? - Regular {Patricia} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071106043347/http:/typophile.com/node/38794 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jameslangdon

comments.content: This looks like a Neuzeit. One mo.

As you say, it’s custom by Laurenz Brunner: Neuzeit Bold thirteen heavy.

[http://www.ianswork.net/translated/translatedinfo.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20071106043347/http:/www.ianswork.net/translated/translatedinfo.html "http://www.ianswork.net/translated/translatedinfo.html")

Hm… I’d expected it to be a bold [DIN Neuzeit Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20071106043347/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/din_neuzeit_grotesk_light_condensed_std_ot/), but there’s no such weight in digital.
So I was right. Good one, Angel!
Thanks for the knowledge, I hate it when it’s custom! Nice type though.
